data.title: Al-Andalus: The Art of Islamic Spain
data.meta_description: AL Andalus handout - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document provides a history of Islamic rule in Al-Andalus (711-1492 CE) and the lasting legacy it left on art, culture, and architecture in Spain. It discusses the major Islamic dynasties that ruled including the Umayyads (771-1031 CE), Taifa Kingdoms (1031-1086 CE), Almoravids and Almohads (1088-1232 CE), and Nasrid Kingdom (1238-1492 CE) based in Granada. Key architectural features introduced during this period included the horseshoe arch, lobed arches, and decorative motifs like geometric patterns, epigraphy, and stylised floral designs which can still be seen in
